allocationEmptyState.text:
<0>You haven’t made any allocations yet.
Need a bit of help getting started?

allocationInfoBoxes.decisionWindowClosed: The decision window is now closed. Allocating funds is not possible.
allocationInfoBoxes.connectWallet: In order to manipulate allocation values and vote, please connect your wallet first.

budgetBox.approve2Transactions: Please approve 2 transactions in your wallet. The first (required only once and for locking) allows ERC-20 tokens, and the second locks / unlocks GLM.
budgetBox.stakeWillUpdate: Your stake will update when the transaction is confirmed
budgetBox.waitingForTransactionHash: Waiting for transaction hash from Etherscan...

metricsTimeSection.descriptionText: Allocation is the currently active governance period of the epoch when you can allocate funds to projects you want to support.

modalEffectiveLockedBalance.text:
Effective Balance refers to Locked GLM that has been locked for a full epoch and is generating rewards. Rewards for GLM locked during Epoch <0>T will be available in Epoch <1>T+2.

Consider locking 100 GLM in Epoch 1 and 1000 GLM in Epoch 2. During Epoch 2 Locked Balance will be 1100 GLM, but Effective Balance will be 100 GLM, because the 1000 GLM has not been locked for a full epoch yet.

During Epoch 3, rewards will be generated on the entire balance, so Effective Balance will become 1100 GLM.

modalGlmLock.cantUnlock: You can't unlock more than you have locked
modalGlmLock.dontHaveEnough: You don't have enough to lock that amount

modalWithdrawEth.withdrawalsDistributedEpoch: Withdrawals are distributed when Epoch {{currentEpoch}} ends
modalWithdrawEth.dontHaveThatMuchToWithdraw: You don't have that much to withdraw

connectWallet.title: Connect wallet
connectWallet.text: Please connect your wallet to Octant in order to participate in this and future epochs

lockGlm.title: Lock GLM to earn
lockGlm.text: Lock GLM tokens for at least one full epoch to earn ETH rewards you can donate or withdraw

rewards.title: You have rewards!
rewards.text: During allocation period you can donate rewards to projects and allocate them to yourself

tip.title: Withdraw ETH
tip.text: Rewards you allocate to yourself can be withdrawn to your wallet here in the Earn view

metrics.glmLockedTotalSupplyPercentage: GLM Locked as % of Total Supply

tip.title: Check the stats
tip.text: View the data about all the decisions taken in the previous epoch here in <0>Metrics</0>

metrics.totalValueStakedDescription: The total value staked on Octant to date, showing ETH staked by the Golem Foundation and GLM locked by Octant users.

welcomeToOctant.text:
Octant is a Golem Foundation experiment in decentralised governance and funding projects for the public good.

To get started, connect your wallet and lock some GLM in the Earn tab. If you don’t have any GLM or you want to know more about locking, this <0> blog post has all you need to know to get started.

stakingRewards.text:
If you lock more than 100 GLM, you will earn rewards in ETH for every epoch you have tokens locked. Tokens can be unlocked at any time.

You can choose to withdraw your earnings or allocate them to public good projects, which you can browse in the <0>Projects tab.

allocateOrWithdraw.text:
Projects you shortlist for allocation will appear here in the <0>Allocate tab. You can allocate some, or all of your ETH rewards.

Rewards allocated will have Golem Foundation match funding applied, so donating will multiply the impact of your earnings compared to withdrawing it.

moreInformation.text:
The <0>Metrics tab shows a range of stats about the current and previous epochs to help inform your allocation decisions and generally provide an overview of Octant.

Still have questions or want to reach out?
Read the <1>Docs or join us on <2>Discord.

proposal.loadingProblem: Loading of this proposal encountered a problem.

tip.title: Add your favourites
tip.text: Save projects to the Allocate view with the heart icon so you can donate rewards to them
